name: Format\ConditionalTableCellStyle
description: The object for applying a style to table cells that meet certain conditions.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description:
The background color for the cell.
If this property is omitted, the background is transparent.
The cell background color is highest priority, followed by the column, and finally the row. All three colors are applied, meaning that non-opaque values can cause combined colors. For example, using a red row together with a blue column, both with 50% opacity, creates a purple cell.

properties.name: border
properties.description: The border for the cell. Because the border is drawn inside the cell, it affects the size of the content within the cell. The bigger the border, the less available space for content.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
The height of the cell and its row, as a number in points, or using one of the available units of measure for components.
By default, the height of each row is determined by the height of the content in that row. See .

properties.name: horizontalAlignment
properties.description: The horizontal alignment of content inside cells.

properties.name: minimumWidth
properties.description: The minimum width of the cell and its column, as a number in points or using one of the available units of measure for components.

properties.name: padding
properties.description: The space around the content in a table cell in points, supported units, or a  object that specifies padding for each side separately.

properties.name: selectors
properties.description:
An array of one or more selectors, each of which specifies one or more conditions.
This conditional table cell style is applied to cells that meet all of the conditions of at least one of the selectors.

properties.name: textStyle
properties.description: The name string of one of your styles in the Article  object.

properties.name: verticalAlignment
properties.description: Defines the vertical alignment of content inside cells.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The column width, as a percentage only. This property only indicates proportionate width and cannot be used to control exact width. See minimumWidth.
